CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1945, pg. 17, reads: "Red Feather Booster - Among those going all out to push the current Community Fund Drive over the top are energetic Scout troops. In a patriotic gesture are, left to right: Norman Shook of Troop 53, Greenfield; Joan Meyer, Troop 3, Knoxville, and Donald Dudley, Cub Pack 295 of A. Leo Weil School.  The scouts were attending a banquet and report meeting at the William Penn Hotel, Monday. - Courier Photo by Harris"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Boy Scouts, from left: Norman Shook, Joan Meyer, and Donald Dudley, saluting behind banquet table at William Penn Hotel
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boys--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Salutations--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Boy Scouts--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Girl Scouts of the United States of America.Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Banquets--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.

cutline: Red Feather Booster - Among those going all out to push the current Community Fund Drive over the top are energetic Scout troops. In a patriotic gesture are, left to right: Norman Shook of Troop 53, Greenfield; Joan Meyer, Troop 3, Knoxville, and Donald Dudley, Cub Pack 295 of A. Leo Weil School.  The scouts were attending a banquet and report meeting at the William Penn Hotel, Monday. - Courier Photo by Harris
